title: What's News: Business & Finance
text:
U.S. and European businesses reported robust demand in November that, combined with persistent parts and labor shortages, led to record price increases.

Best Buy's quarterly e-commerce sales fell and Dick's online sales were flat as consumers did more shopping in stores than they did last year.

Musk's tax bill on exercised Tesla stock options fell with the decline in the company's stock price after the CEO tweeted about selling some of his holdings.

Global financial regulators boosted capital requirements for JPMorgan, Goldman and BNP under rules intended to help avoid a repeat of the 2008 financial crisis.

A group of U.S. agencies said they plan next year to begin delineating how banks can legally get involved in cryptocurrencies.

Major U.S. stock indexes ended mixed. The S&P 500 and Dow gained 0.2% and 0.5%, respectively, while the Nasdaq fell 0.5%.

The Justice Department filed an antitrust lawsuit challenging U.S. Sugar's proposed purchase of Imperial, arguing the tie-up would lead to higher prices.

What's News: Business & Finance
